org.gwt.mosaic.core.client
Class DOM

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.DOM
      org.gwt.mosaic.core.client.DOM

public class DOM
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.DOM

Provides helper methods for DOM elements.

Author:
georgopoulos.georgios(at)gmail.com

public static int[] getBorderSizes(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem)

Parameters:
elem - the element to get the border size of
Returns:
an array of the top, right, bottom, left borders

Parameters:
elem - the element to get the size of
Returns:
an array of width and height

getClientSize

public static int[] getClientSize(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem)
Get's the elements clientHeight and clientWidth. clientHeight/Width is a non-standard, HTML-specific property introduced in the IE object model.

Parameters:
elem - the element to get the size of
Returns:
an array of width and height

Returns:

getRegion

public static Region getRegion(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem)
Returns the region position of the given element. The element must be part of the DOM tree to have a region (display:none or elements not appended return null).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current region position we want to know
Returns:
a region containing "top, left, bottom, right" member data

getRowIndex

Gets the row index of a row element.

Parameters:
tr - the row element
Returns:
the row index

getStyleAttribute

                                                 java.lang.String attr)
Gets an attribute of the given element's style.

Parameters:
elem - the element whose style attribute is to be retrieved
attr - the name of the style attribute to be retrieved
Returns:
the style attribute's value

getX

public static java.lang.Integer getX(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem)
Gets the current X position of an element based on page coordinates. The element must be part of the DOM tree to have coordinates (display: none or elements not appended return null).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current X position we want to know
Returns:
the X position of the element

getXY

public static Point getXY(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem)
Gets the current position of an element based on page coordinates. Element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return null).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current position we want to know
Returns:
the XY position of the element

getY

public static java.lang.Integer getY(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem)
Gets the current Y position of an element based on page coordinates. The element must be part of the DOM tree to have coordinates (display: none or elements not appended return null).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current Y position we want to know
Returns:
the Y position of the element

parseInt

protected static java.lang.Integer parseInt(java.lang.String str)
Parses a string and returns an integer.

NOTE: Only the first number in the string is returned!

NOTE: Leading and trailing spaces are allowed.

NOTE: If the first character cannot be converted to a number, parseInt() returns null.

Parameters:
str - the string to be parsed
Returns:
the parsed value

parseInt

protected static java.lang.Integer parseInt(java.lang.String str,
                                            int radix)
Parses a string and returns an integer.

NOTE: Only the first number in the string is returned!

NOTE: Leading and trailing spaces are allowed.

NOTE: If the first character cannot be converted to a number, parseInt() returns null.

Parameters:
str - the string to be parsed
radix - a number (from 2 to 36) that represents the numeric system to be used
Returns:
the parsed value

parseInt

protected static int parseInt(java.lang.String str,
                              int radix,
                              int defaultValue)
Parses a string and returns an integer.

NOTE: Only the first number in the string is returned!

NOTE: Leading and trailing spaces are allowed.

NOTE: If the first character cannot be converted to a number, parseInt() returns null.

Parameters:
str - the string to be parsed
radix - a number (from 2 to 36) that represents the numeric system to be used
defaultValue - the value to return if the parsed value was null
Returns:
the parsed value

rawFirstChild

public static com.google.gwt.user.client.Element rawFirstChild(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem)
Gets the first child. You must *KNOW* that the first child exists and is an element to use this method safely.

setContentAreaHeight

public static int setContentAreaHeight(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem,
                                       int height)
Sets the height of the element based on the border and padding size of the element.

Parameters:
elem - the elements to have it's height set
height - the height that you want it the element set to
Returns:
the new height, fixed for borders, paddings and IE QuirksMode

setContentAreaWidth

public static int setContentAreaWidth(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem,
                                      int width)
Sets the width of the element based on the border and padding size of the element.

Parameters:
elem - the elements to have it's width set
width - the width that you want it the element set to
Returns:
the new width, fixed for borders, paddings and IE QuirksMode

setStyleAttribute

public static void setStyleAttribute(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem,
                                     java.lang.String attr,
                                     java.lang.String value)
Sets an attribute on the given element's style.

Parameters:
elem - the element whose style attribute is to be set
attr - the name of the style attribute to be set
value - the style attribute's new value

setX

public static Point setX(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem,
                         int x)
Set the X position of an HTML element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned. The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display: none or elements not appended return null).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current X position we want to set
x - the value to use as the X coordinate for the element
Returns:
new XY position of the element

setXY

public static Point setXY(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem,
                          Point pos)
Sets the position of an HTML element in page coordinates, regardless or how the element is positioned. The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current XY position we want to set
pos - contains the X & Y values for new position (coordinates are page-based)
Returns:
the new XY position of the element

setXY

public static Point setXY(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem,
                          Point pos,
                          boolean noRetry)
Sets the position of an HTML element in page coordinates, regardless or how the element is positioned. The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display:none or elements not appended return false).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current XY position we want to set
pos - contains the X & Y values for new position (coordinates are page-based)
noRetry - by default we try and set the position a second time if the first fails
Returns:
the new XY position of the element

setY

public static Point setY(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element elem,
                         int y)
Set the Y position of an HTML element in page coordinates, regardless of how the element is positioned. The element must be part of the DOM tree to have page coordinates (display: none or elements not appended return null).

Parameters:
elem - the element whose current Y position we want to set
y - the value to use as the Y coordinate for the element
Returns:
new XY position of the element

standardizeKeycode

public static int standardizeKeycode(int code)
Normalized key codes. Also switches KEY_RIGHT and KEY_LEFT in RTL languages.
